entry.title: CivilNet becomes first Armenian news site to join Meta‚Äôs third-party fact-checking program

media:group.media:title: CivilNet becomes first Armenian news site to join Meta‚Äôs third-party fact-checking program
media:group.media:description:
üìç Azerbaijan‚Äôs president said he believes his country can reach a normalization deal with Armenia ‚Äúwithin several months,‚Äù while the U.S. secretary of state said he believes a peace deal between Yerevan and Baku remains ‚Äúachievable‚Äù and ‚Äúwithin reach.‚Äù üìç Freedom House found Azerbaijan‚Äôs actions in Nagorno-Karabakh since 2020 amounted to ethnic cleansing and urged the International Criminal Court to open an investigation. üìç An overhauled version of Armenia‚Äôs domestic violence law went into effect, a move that women‚Äôs rights advocates welcomed as historic. Read more: https://shorturl.at/yXDrv üìç CivilNet became the first Armenian news organization to join Meta‚Äôs expanding third-party fact-checking program. Read more: https://shorturl.at/DtbTl

entry.title: Modern approaches for mental health recovery: Hovhannes Nikoghosyan

media:group.media:title: Modern approaches for mental health recovery: Hovhannes Nikoghosyan
media:group.media:description:
00:00 Intro and personal history 3:36 Important values that make a good leader 8:56 Spirituality 10:02 The Armenian Spiritual Revival Foundation 14:44 Armenians as ‚ÄòSupersurvivors‚Äô 16:20 Complacency and indifference 18:41 Human connection and reviving communities 21:50 The role of the Armenian church in times of crisis 26:00 The best piece of advice received 27:21 Conclusions and expectations of the Foundation
This episode explores the life of Hovhanness Nikoghosyan, from his childhood and education in Armenia and the US, to his life as the Executive Director of the Armenian Spiritual Revival Foundation, established by Noubar Afeyan in collaboration with the Armenian Apostolic Church. We explore important topics such as leadership, spirituality and the foundation's work. Finally, Hovhannes shares his views on the importance of the church, history, human connections and working with grace.
About Hovhannes Nikoghosyan
Hovhannes Nikoghosyan is the Executive Director of the Armenian Spiritual Revival Foundation, an organization whose mission is to transform modern approaches to mental health recovery in post-crisis situations by creating "spiritual-psychological" solutions. The foundation was established by Dr. Noubar Afeyan in partnership with the Armenian Apostolic Church. As a political science scholar, Nikoghosyan has been a Visiting Fellow with the Center for Strategic and International Studies in Washington, DC, the Magdalena Yesil Visiting Scholar at Sanford School of Public Policy, and Duke University (Durham, NC). He has completed an Advanced Certificate Program at the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy and Tufts University (Medford, MA). From 2010 to 2018 he worked at the Office of the President of the Republic of Armenia and from 2017 to 2018, became the Aide to the President. He is a graduate of the Russian-Armenian (Slavonic) University with an MA in International Relations and a Ph.D. in Political Science (2011). He has authored a number of peer-reviewed papers and expert reports published in Armenia and abroad.
Program Overview Mindful Leaders dives into the stories of people who have achieved prominence, walked incredible journeys, and have defined culture.
Lara sits down with specialists, thinkers, and change catalysts to deconstruct insights, events, and lessons that have shaped their personal and professional lives and have enabled them to create meaning and connection.

entry.title: Pashinyan appears to rule out EU referendum for Armenia

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan appears to rule out EU referendum for Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia and Ukraine‚Äôs top diplomats met to review relations and discuss security. üìç Yerevan‚Äôs ambassador to Moscow visited the frontline Russian city of Belgorod. üìç Armenia‚Äôs prime minister signaled he would not support holding a referendum on European Union membership, admitting Brussels may not be ready to accept Yerevan. üìç This Week In Business: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2WcWOTMFhZk

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs EU bid ‚Äònot very likely,‚Äô finance minister tells CivilNet: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs EU bid ‚Äònot very likely,‚Äô finance minister tells CivilNet: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs finance minister poured cold water on the country‚Äôs potential to join the European Union, telling CivilNet his agency is not currently planning for that scenario. üìç Interview with Armenia‚Äôs Finance Minister Vahe Hovhannisyan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3BsnRQR2IoA üìç Operations at Amulsar, Armenia‚Äôs long-stalled gold mine, can begin as soon as next spring, a senior Eurasian Development Bank official suggests. üìç Armenia‚Äôs government is facing a historic, $1.2B lawsuit from Walnort Finance, which owns a 12.5% stake in the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Combine, Armenia‚Äôs biggest mine.
